title: How to Make Crab Dip

steps.headline: Chop the crab meat into small, diced pieces and set aside.
steps.description: You can also shred the crab meat if you prefer that texture. Just make sure that you don’t leave the crab meat sitting for more than a few minutes, or it might begin to spoil. Refrigerate the crab meat if you need time to prepare your other ingredients.

steps.headline: Combine the cream cheese, mayonnaise, milk, salt, and garlic power in a large bowl.
steps.description: Use a strong fork or hand mixer to mix the ingredients together. Refrigerate the mixture if you will not be using it right away.

steps.headline: Add the crab meat to the cream cheese mixture and combine well.
steps.description: Make sure that all of the crab meat is coated with the cream cheese mixture. If you plan to add in any extras, now is a good time to do that.

steps.headline: Refrigerate the crab dip for about one hour.
steps.description: Cold crab dip tastes best when it is very cold, so you will need to keep your crab dip in the refrigerator for at least an hour. To have your crab dip ready when you are, make it the night before and refrigerate it overnight.

steps.headline: Mix the ingredients again and serve.
steps.description: To ensure that your crab dip is well combined and has a nice consistency, give it a quick stir before serving. Serve your crab dip with bread, tortilla chips, crackers, or sliced veggies.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
steps.description: You will want the oven to be nice and hot so that you can bake your crab dip as soon as you have finished preparing the mixture. You will also need to grease a casserole dish with non-stick cooking spray.

steps.headline: Chop the crab meat into small, diced pieces and set aside.
steps.description: You can also shred the crab meat if you prefer that texture. Just make sure that you don’t leave the crab meat sitting for more than a few minutes or it might begin to spoil. Refrigerate the crab meat if you need time to prepare your other ingredients.

steps.headline: Combine the cream cheese, mayonnaise, salt, and garlic power in a large bowl.
steps.description: Use a strong fork or hand mixer to mix the ingredients together. Refrigerate the mixture if you will not be using it right away.

steps.headline: Add the crab meat to the cream cheese mixture and combine well.
steps.description: Make sure that all of the crab meat is coated with the cream cheese mixture. If you plan to add in any extras, now is a good time to do that.

steps.headline: Transfer the mixture to the casserole dish.
steps.description: Use a plastic or silicon spatula to scrape the sides of the dish. Add any toppings that you would like, such as cheese or breadcrumbs. Place the dish in the oven. Make sure to use oven mitts when placing anything into the oven.

steps.headline: Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.
steps.description: Set a timer so that you know when the time is up. If the crab dip does not look ready, cook it for five minutes more and check again. Remove from the oven when finished. Make sure to use oven mitts when taking anything out of the oven.

steps.headline: Allow to cool down a bit and then serve your crab dip.
steps.description: Wait for about 10 minutes or so to make sure that the crab dip is not too hot. Serve your crab dip with bread, tortilla chips, crackers, or sliced veggies.

steps.headline: Add chopped onions to add crunch and zing.
steps.description: This option works well with cold or hot crab dip. Chop a medium sized onion of your choice. Mix the chopped onion into your crab dip mixture before refrigerating or baking. Or, try caramelizing the onions first. Cover and cook them in some olive oil or butter on low-medium heat until they are browned and soft.

steps.headline: Add tomatoes to brighten the flavor.
steps.description: This option works well with cold or hot crab dip. Chop a couple of medium sized tomatoes. Remove the seeds. Mix the chopped tomatoes into your crab dip mixture before refrigerating or baking.

steps.headline: Add fresh spinach for extra nutrition.
steps.description: This option works well with cold or hot crab dip. Mix about 2 cups of fresh spinach into your crab dip mixture before refrigerating or baking.

steps.headline: Add shredded cheese to make it more savory.
steps.description: This option works best with hot crab dip. Mix about 1 cup of shredded cheese f your choice into the crab dip mixture. Then, sprinkle ½-1 cup over the top of your crab dip before you put it into the oven.

steps.headline: Add bread crumbs for a golden crunchy crust.
steps.description: This option works best with hot crab dip. Sprinkle 1 cup of bread crumbs over the top of your crab dip right before you put it into the oven.

steps.headline: Add minced garlic for extra spice.
steps.description: This option works well with cold or hot crab dip. Mix about 3-4 cloves of minced garlic into your crab dip mixture before refrigerating or baking.

steps.headline: Add chopped fresh herbs to make it more flavorful.
steps.description: This option works well with cold or hot crab dip. Chop up some fresh herbs of your choice, like rosemary, dill, sage, or basil. Mix about 1/4 cup of chopped fresh herbs into your crab dip mixture before refrigerating or baking.

steps.headline: Add a few dashes of a hot sauce of your choice for heat.
steps.description: This option works well with cold or hot crab dip. Mix about 3 or more dashes of hot sauce into your crab dip mixture before refrigerating or baking.
